member.name: T:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage
member.summary:
An enum that represents the available icons in the data tree. Certain images are not part of the stock Silk image package.
Silk Images come from https://famfamfam.com/
To determine the icon of a TreeNode, simply cast one of these enums to an int and set ImageIndex to the int value. As such, this requires that the indices of images in the TreeNode (see WinForms editor) match up to these.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Generic
member.summary: A blue square representing a generic object. Intended to represent an object of an unknown type.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Object
member.summary: An icon of a data tree with a single parent object containing two children. An alternative to that serves the same purpose.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Scene
member.summary: A picture of a the globe, intended to represent an entire scene.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Sky
member.summary: A picture of the sky, intended to represent a skybox object.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Model
member.summary: A wooden box representing an entire model. Intended to represent a model.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.ModelSet
member.summary: A set of three bricks, each with a unique color. Intended to represent a set of several models grouped together.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Articulated
member.summary: An icon of a person. Intended to represent articulated models, which have bones and often animations, specifically an ArticulatedConfig.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Billboard
member.summary: An icon of an application window. Intended to represent a billboard GUI element.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Static
member.summary: A single building brick. Intended to represent a static model (just geometry and nothing else), specifically a StaticConfig.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.MergedStatic
member.summary: A set of three building bricks. Intended to represent a bulk collection of several static models, specifically a MergedStaticConfig.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Sound
member.summary: A picture of a speaker. Intended to represent a sound emitter object.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Attachment
member.summary: A picture of an electric plug. Intended to represent an external object that attaches to another model in its current context, for instance, the Thwacker Gremlin model has an attachment for their hammer. The hammer should use this icon in this context.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Derived
member.summary: A picture of two objects with arrows pointing between them. Intended to represent a derived model class, specifically a ModelConfig.Derived.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Conditional
member.summary: A picture of an arrow that diverges. Intended to represent an element that determines conditional attributes in gameplay, specifically a ConditionalConfig.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.CameraShake
member.summary: A picture of a camera with a small lightning bolt in the lower right corner. Intended to represent an element that causes the user's camera to shake in gameplay.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Generated
member.summary: A picture of a PC with a small plus symbol in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a model that is generated on the fly from a set of parameters.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Schemed
member.summary: A picture of an application window with a small pencil in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a schemed object, specifically a ModelConfig.Schemed.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.SchemedModel
member.summary: A picture of a single building brick with a small pencil in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a schemed model, specifically a ModelConfig.SchemedModel.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Scheme
member.summary: A picture of a computer monitor with a small pencil in the lower right corner. This is intended to represent an actual render scheme. This should be used on any instances of a class like ViewerEffectConfig that have no model reference and are direct descendants to a ModelConfig.Schemed.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Animation
member.summary: A picture of a snippet of film. Intended to represent an animation, specifically a AnimationConfig.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Scripted
member.summary: Intended to represent a scene object that has code running within it, usually for gameplay purposes.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.TimeAction
member.summary: Intended to represent an extension of that runs on a timer ScriptedConfig.TimeAction

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Config
member.summary: A generic icon of a cog. Used for any extra data that is best described as configuration data.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Shading
member.summary: A generic icon of diagonal hashes. Internally this is used to represent fog.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Reference
member.summary: An icon of a hand pointing to a miniature variant of , intended to represent an external reference to another model.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Array
member.summary: An icon of a piece of paper with a blue <> pattern on it.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Texture
member.summary: An icon of a framed picture intended to represent an image texture.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Variant
member.summary: An icon of a cardboard box intended to represent a variation of a model.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Light
member.summary: A picture of a lightbulb. Intended to represent a source of light.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Value
member.summary: A picture of a hand pointing to a text box containing an arbitrary value.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Triangle
member.summary: A blue triangle, intended to represent more rudimentary components of models (e.g. sub-models in a static model).

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Tile
member.summary: A green square of grass that represents a tile in a TudeySceneModel

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Matrix
member.summary: A 3x3 grid of blocks within square brackets [ ] that represents a transformation matrix, intended for Transform3D

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Missing
member.summary: A transparent red building brick intended to represent a missing asset.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Tag
member.summary: A tag, like a cardboard price tag that hangs off of an object.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Wrench
member.summary: An orange wrench.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.MissingConfig
member.summary: Identical to but with a warning icon on it.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.Editable
member.summary: Identical to but it has a pencil on it.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.RedTag
member.summary: Identical to but the inner part is red instead of blue.

member.name: F:XDataTree.Data.SilkImage.None
member.summary: A transparent space. Note that it is not advised to use this when no icon is applicable. Consider using instead.

member.name: T:XDataTree.TreeElement
member.summary: Represents an element in a data tree in its most minimal form.

member.name: F:XDataTree.TreeElement.Children
member.summary: All child nodes of this .

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.Properties
member.summary: If this has associated properties (mostly used for a second data tree view), then this is the element of the actual properties window.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.Icon
member.summary: The icon displayed on this tree element.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.Text
member.summary: The text displayed on this element.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.Tooltip
member.summary: A tooltip to display on this.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.CanContainChildren
member.summary: Whether or not this element in the data tree can have objects inside of it.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.IsEditable
member.summary: Whether or not this tree element can be edited in some fashion. This causes its text to display in blue with an underline.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElement.EquivalentNode
member.summary: Only available after calling , this is the equivalent for use in a WinForms based application.

member.summary: Clears all child elements from this instance, if supported.

member.summary: Removes the given from this element's child list.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElement.OnSelected(System.Threading.SynchronizationContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes when this tree element is clicked on or highlighted.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElement.OnDeselected(System.Threading.SynchronizationContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes when this tree element is deselected, either by something else being clicked on or it being unhighlighted.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElement.OnActivated(System.Threading.SynchronizationContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes when this element is double clicked on or the enter key is pressed while it's selected.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElement.ConvertToNode
member.summary: Converts this into a . If this has any child elements, they are converted as well.
member.remarks: This sets the property to its equivalent . Likewise, this populates

member.name: T:XDataTree.TreeElements.GenericElement
member.summary: A generic containing text and an icon. Can contain child nodes. It is best compared to a folder, with no special functionality on its own.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.GenericElement.#ctor(System.String,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage)
member.summary: A generic containing text and an icon. Can contain child nodes.
member.param: The text displayed on this node.
The icon used for this node.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.GenericElement.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the text to the given .

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.GenericElement.SetIcon(XDataTree.Data.SilkImage)
member.summary: Sets the icon to the given .

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.GenericElement.SetCanContainChildren(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes whether or not child elements are allowed.

member.name: T:XDataTree.TreeElements.Interop.EventHandlingTreeNode
member.summary: An extension to that provides methods that execute when this is selected, deselected, or double-clicked / return is pressed.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.Interop.EventHandlingTreeNode.OnSelected
member.summary: An action that will occur when this node is selected.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.Interop.EventHandlingTreeNode.OnDeselected
member.summary: An action that will occur when this node is deselected.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.Interop.EventHandlingTreeNode.OnActivated
member.summary: An action that will occur when this node is double clicked, or when the return key is pressed on it.

member.name: T:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement
member.summary: A container for one or more s. This is primarily useful for cases where bulk-setting a lot of key/value pairs is necessary due to its inclusion of dedicated methods to handle these cases.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.#ctor(System.String,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage)
member.summary: Create a new , which is intended to contain one or more s.
member.param: The text to display on this container.
The icon to use for this container.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.Add(System.String,System.Object,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage)
member.summary: Adds the given key/value pair to this container. Converts the pair into a .
member.param: The value to display. The method will be used on this.
The icon to use for this value. It is recommended that this is uniform for all entries, but it is not required.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.Add(XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement)
member.summary: Directly adds the given to this container.
member.param: The element to add to this container.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the first element that has the given key.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.Remove(XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement)
member.summary: Directly removes the given from this container.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.SetToEnumerable(System.Collections.IEnumerable,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the contents of this container to an . The child will use [n] as their keys, and ToString() of each array element as values. If this is an of (or, a ) then this will treat it accordingly.
member.param: The object array to use in this container.

If defined, this is a 1:1 override of the images used on a given value object. That is, [0] is the image used on [0], [1] for [1], and so on for each index. If the length of this is 1, then that icon is used for all elements.
If true, keys will be blank strings instead of the array index.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueContainerElement.SetToDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the contents of this container to a dictionary. The child will use the result of for both the key and value.
member.param: The dictionary to use in this container.
If defined, this is a 1:1 override of the images used on a given value object. That is, [key0] is the image used on [key0], [key1] for [key1], and so on for each index.
If true, and if a key exists in but not , then an exception will be raised instead of defaulting to

member.name: T:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement
member.summary: A "key-value" element contains dedicated and properties that both enforce certain text-based parameters. It cannot contain child nodes, but in turn, can optionally display its value as a child element. To create a list of many key/value pairs together, consider using .

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement.ValueHolder
member.summary:
The object containing the possible values for this , assuming it's editable.
In most cases, this is something like a StaticSetConfig's ShadowClass.

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement.Key
member.summary: The key for this element. Displays as a prefix in : "Key: "
member.remarks: If is or whitespace, then will point directly to this and nothing else (it will not have the trailing colon either).

member.name: P:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement.Value
member.summary: The value for this element. Displays as a suffix in : "Value".
member.remarks: If is or whitespace, then will point directly to this and nothing else.

member.name: M:XDataTree.TreeElements.KeyValueElement.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,XDataTree.Data.SilkImage)
member.summary: Construct a new with the given key and value, optionally defining it as editable.
member.param: Whether or not this is intended to be edited, which makes the text show in blue with an underline.
The icon to use on this node.
